instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: ​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Green/orange light, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> low. Not booting.
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a
very light blue corrosion around probe 106 area under the hard drive but does not look like direct water damge. 


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V</SIGNAL> 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3</SIGNAL> 12.56v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> 16.16v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 15.9v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.425v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.425v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 2.5v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 52.3mv


<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 1.36k resistance to ground

beep across <CAPACITOR>C1031</CAPACITOR> is this normal?
logic board looks really clean, liquid contact indicators are perfect.
I know there is a short on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> but i can't seem to find it.
Do you guys have any suggestions?


<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> 470k 
voltage on <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> on one side is 16.5v and on system side 14.8

threads.title: ​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Green/orange light, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> low. Not booting.
threads.message: Remove flex from J4800 and check <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> again.....

threads.title: ​<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Green/orange light, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> low. Not booting.
threads.message: Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, it is needed to activate <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, this signal comes from SMC.....
